column1: The Gorontalo language (also called Hulontalo) is a language spoken in Gorontalo Province (Northern Sulawesi
column3: southern coast) by the Gorontaloan people. Dialects of Gorontalo are East Gorontalo

column2: where C may be /b d t d̠ ɟ ɡ k/. Elsewhere
column3: /b d/ are relatively rare and only occur before high vowels. /d̠/
column5: is a laminal post-alveoral coronal stop that is indeterminate as to voicing. The phonemic status of [ʔ] is unclear; if [VʔV] is interpreted as vowel sequences /VV/
column6: then this contrasts with long vowels (where the two V's are the same) and vowel sequences separated by linking glides (where the two V's are different).
